insight.episode_summary: Meg and Keri trade listener-submitted holiday recipes and the family stories behind themâ€”from no-bake Nanaimo bars and butter tarts to glumpki cabbage rolls and We Little Meatballsâ€”spotlighting no-bake Nanaimo bars, Swedish meatballs with allspice, and pumpkin gingerbread with caramel sauce. They also share cookie-tray standouts (almond paste cookies, potato chip cookies), cozy breakfast traditions (candy cane pancakes, quiche, Wife Saver), and a free digital holiday cookbook you can download via their Redesigning Health and Home socials.

keywords.semantic_note: Canadian term; U.S. audiences often search for 'cookie platter' or 'dessert tray'

shareable_quotes.quote: â€œMy dad loved it. Now that heâ€™s gone, I remember the way he reacted with the first taste. It makes me feel close to him when heâ€™s no longer at our table.â€
shareable_quotes.platform_notes: Use cozy kitchen B-roll of whisking/baking, then cut to a still photo of Dad if available. Add soft piano bed, warm film grain. Big serif caption text on-screen. Best for Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts; repurpose on LinkedIn with a reflective caption.

shareable_quotes.quote: â€œMom toasted white bread two slices at a time, and weâ€™d race to the toaster, rip it into chunks, and fill a huge bowl for her stuffingâ€”the night-before-Thanksgiving ritual we still love.â€
shareable_quotes.platform_notes: Open with toaster â€˜popâ€™ SFX, quick cuts of hands ripping toast, and a vintage photo overlay. Add on-screen step labels (Toast. Rip. Bowl.). Great for Reels and TikTok; try a side-by-side of old photos vs. today on YouTube Shorts.

shareable_quotes.quote: â€œEvery year since they were little, Gib makes candy cane pancakes for Christmas Eve breakfastâ€”Ziploc baggies of candy canes for the kids to smash. Think Elf: syrup and candy canes.â€
shareable_quotes.platform_notes: POV shot: kids smashing candy canes (ASMR crunch), overhead pancake pour, festive jingle. Use bold playful text overlays. Works on Reels, TikTok, Shorts; add recipe steps in the description for YouTube Shorts.

communities.name: r/Baking
